column1: #Text=2) Dissolve 1699 g of (high purity) silver nitrate in 2100 ml deionized water.
#Text=3) Add sodium hydroxide solution slowly to silver nitrate solution with stirring while maintaining a temperature of 50.degree.
#Text=Stir for 15 minutes after addition is complete, and then lower the temperature to 40.degree.
#Text=4) Insert clean filter wands and withdraw as much water as possible from the precipitate created in step (3) in order to remove sodium and nitrate ions.
#Text=Measure the conductivity of the water removed and add back as much fresh aleionized water as was removed by the filter wands.
#Text=Repeat this process until the conductivity of the water removed is less than 90 .mu.mho/cm.
#Text=5) Add 630 g of high-purity oxalic acid dihydrate in approximately 100 g increments.
#Text=Add the last portion of oxalic acid dihydrate slowly and monitor pH to ensure that pH does not drop below 7.8.
#Text=6) Remove as much water from the mixture as possible using clean filter wands in order to form a highly concentrated silver-containing slurry.
